org.openhubframework.openhub.core.common.asynch.msg

Class MessageOperationServiceImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openhubframework.openhub.core.common.asynch.msg.MessageOperationServiceImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MessageOperationService

    @Service
public class MessageOperationServiceImpl
extends Object
implements MessageOperationService
    MessageOperationService implements methods to interact with the integrations messages and if necessary to manipulate their properties, such as state, timestamps, etc.
    Author:
    Viliam Elischer

    • Method Detail

      • restartMessage

        @Transactional
public void restartMessage(long messageId,
                                          boolean totalRestart)
        Method restarts message enables the option for the user to re-set/restart a message in a FAILED/CANCEL state. Steps:
        1. Determine, if msg with ID exists in message table
        2. Update the state of the msg with ID to 'PARTLY_FAILED' in the message table
        3. Try to delete, the record based on msg ID from external_call table
        When the totalRestart is true the condition operation_name = 'confirmation' is NOT USED. And all records form external_call with the given MessageID are removed.
        Specified by:
        restartMessage in interface MessageOperationService
        Parameters:
        messageId - ID of the message that the user wants to restart
        totalRestart - Variable acts as SQL WHERE condition toggle between 2 statements

      • cancelMessage

        @Transactional
public void cancelMessage(long messageId)
        Description copied from interface: MessageOperationService
        Cancels next message processing, sets MsgStateEnum.CANCEL state. Only MsgStateEnum.NEW, MsgStateEnum.PARTLY_FAILED and MsgStateEnum.POSTPONED messages can be canceled.
        Specified by:
        cancelMessage in interface MessageOperationService
        Parameters:
        messageId - the message ID
